dt: {bc}a representative sent to {a_link|observe} but not participate officially in an activity (such as a meeting or war)
{bc}an expert analyst and commentator in a particular field

shortdef: a representative sent to observe but not participate officially in an activity (such as a meeting or war)
an expert analyst and commentator in a particular field

dt.t: Even a {it}casual observer{/it} can tell that the building is in need of repair.

shortdef: someone who is not looking carefully

dt: {bc}occurring between or involving two or more observers

dt.t: The degree of agreement between two or more independent observers in the clinical setting constitutes {wi}interobserver{/wi} reliability and is widely recognized as an important requirement for any behavioral observation procedure …

shortdef: occurring between or involving two or more observers
